channel.title: Home on Ashwin Sundar
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Ashwin Sundar

item.title: Catching Ideas
item.description: Stop Trying to Catch Ideas It’s not a good idea to maximize catching ideas. The brain needs time to refresh itself.

item.title: Django Template Language
item.description: Django Template Language “Front-end” in web development refers to the visual appearance of an application or website. In Django, a web development framework, the front-end is created in DTL (Django Template Language), which is a superset of HTML (Hypertext Markup Language).

item.title: Think Slowly
item.description: Think Slowly January 2024 I recently purchased a mechanical, ergonomic, and split keyboard1. I love the idea of yet another tech gadget to keep me engaged.

item.title: Predictions for 2024
item.description: 2024 Predictions “Halvening” of bitcoin supply around May will result in the price of bitcoin reaching ~$100,000 USD, per the stock-to-flow model.

item.title: Software I liked in 2023
item.description: Software I liked in 2023 Here are some software programs I liked1 in 20232. mermaid.js - Excellent tool for creating architecture (and other) diagrams from text.

item.title: Cheap Web Scorecard
item.description: The Cheap Web Scorecard I recently came across The “Cheap” Web, a self-described “solarpunk philosophy of web design”. I highly recommend reading the whole article, for it’s both a throwback to what the web used to be, as well as a vision for what the future may hold.

item.title: Empty Web Frameworks
item.description: Empty project sizes for popular web frameworks in 2023 Framework Popularity New project size # files React 1 340000K 38219 htmx * 44K 1 Angular 5 295000K 23757 Django 13 20K 9 Gatsby 24 542000K 47703 jQuery 3 88K 1 *: Not in top 34

item.title: Indian Philosophy
item.description: Introduction to Indian Philosophy Preamble Thinking, writing, and speaking about any ancient culture using modern English is extremely challenging. A great deal is lost in translation.

item.title: Prefer Markdown
item.description: Prefer Markdown I have spent a lot of time writing HTML. I wrote my first HTML when I was around 12 years old.

item.title: AWS Cheatsheet
item.description: AWS Cheatsheet Compute Services ECR - Elastic Container Registry, stores images (e.g. Docker) ECS - Elastic Container Service, orchestrates/scales Docker containers

item.title: Future Business
item.description: Future Businesses In recent news, a new Silicon Valley startup is looking for funding. P2P (Penguins to Polar Bears) seeks one-hundred million dollars to repair the damage done to the penguin habitat after last year’s seed baby Btc (Bridge the Caps) built a bridge between the North and South Poles.

item.title: Learning Hard Things
item.description: Learning Hard Things I took a total of one computer science class in my undergraduate degree. It was a CS class geared towards non-CS majors.

item.title: Programming is Engineering
item.description: Programming is Engineering Some people say that computer science isn’t engineering. They’re right. Computer science is the field of first principles, much like physics and chemistry are to mechanical engineering and chemical engineering.

item.title: AI helping a programmer
item.description: AI helping a programmer I am attempting to solve a homework problem that asks me to write a helper function to use in a later problem.

item.title: The Automonk
item.description: The Automonk The Automonk patiently paced the hall, chanting अमर प्रकाश, अंतर्ज्योति in a muted manner that failed to reverbate in the austere marble hall.

item.title: Fibonacci Series in Standard ML
item.description: Creating a Fibonacci Function in Standard ML Date: December 26th, 2022 Challenge Write a recursive function in SML that accepts one i: int argument and returns a list of Fibonacci numbers of length i.

item.title: Untitled Story
item.description: First Draft: Nov 22 2022 Second Draft: Jan 17 2023 PART 1 In retrospect, the access to information humanity once had was severely underappreciated in its time.

item.title: Risk Analysis for Software Projects
item.description: Risk Analysis for Software Projects Original: October 11th, 2022 Revised: August 2023 Introduction In regulated engineering, FMEAs, FTAs, and PRAs are common acronyms for risk management documents.

item.title: Programming Languages
item.description: Programming Languages I recently began a Coursera course called “Programming Languages”, offered by Dan Grossman at the University of Washington. I decided to take this course because the description advertises it as a way to understand the underpinning of all programming languages more thoroughly.

item.title: Back to Square One
item.description: Back to Square One Date: August 1st, 2022 The original version of this website was written using GatsbyJS, a headless CMS engine that’s all the rage right now in the world of web development.

item.title: Technical Communication
item.description: Technical communications for a non-technical audience Date: August 1st, 2022 In every technical contributor’s career, they will be required to communicate technical work to a non-technical audience.

item.title: Ideas that Created the Future
item.description: Review - Ideas that Created the Future Date: July 31st, 2022 In late July 2022, I began reading an excellent book called Ideas that Created the Future - Classic Papers of Computer Science by Harry R.

item.title: Benchmarking Rust code with Criterion.rs
item.description: Benchmarking Rust code using Criterion.rs Introduction Benchmarking is a method of systematically assessing a program for performance. This process is a valuable component of regression testing because it helps you compare changes and improvements to your code.

item.title: Parallel Processing in Rust
item.description: Parallel Processing in Rust Date: April 6th, 2022 Rust is a systems programming language that is quickly gaining traction at well-known companies including Amazon, Discord, Dropbox, Meta, Alphabet, and Microsoft.

item.title: The Color of Film
item.description: The Color of Film Date: April 11th, 2017 They say a picture is worth a thousand words, so I took that literally and built average color pictures for each episode in the first season of Game of Thrones.

item.title: Untitled Story
item.description: Visualizing NBA Pace Part 1: Inspiration I saw this post and knew immediately that I needed to do something similar for the NBA.

item.title: Car Temperatures in Phoenix
item.description: Car Temperatures in Phoenix March 2017 Using a wireless microcontroller, I monitored the temperature on my car’s dashboard and in the passenger footwell for a whole day during a particular hot spell in June in Phoenix.
